projects.title: OWASP ZAP

links.value: See the write-up on my blog for a more in-depth presentation.

projects.description:
Intern at Mozilla during the summer of 2018 in the FoxSec team. I worked on improving OWASP ZAP, for it to be able to scan "modern" web applications.
The effort has been focused around two keys areas: write the FrontEndScanner addon (not yet released) for ZAP to allow users to run "client-side scripts"; and create a front-end library to help debug modern web pages: the @zaproxy/front-end-tracker.

talks.title: Security can also "Shift Left"
talks.description:
We all seek to avoid the tunnel effect by shortening feedback loops. On that aspect, "shifting left" seems pertinent: integrate practices and tools that provide us with information about the state of security of our products as soon as possible, during development, so that one can act on what causes trouble before everything turns sour.
What if security could be treated like any other quality effort? Or are we doomed to see the security of our applications only through audit reports?
 In this talk, I propose to take a look at a couple of tools and techniques that will help uncover security issues that may be hiding within your applications as you are working on them.
